In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure! Here's how you could write such a function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_str)
    result = IOBuffer()
    
    current_line_length = 0
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word) + 1 # add 1 because of the space
        
        if current_line_length + word_length > text_width
            println(result, "")
            current_line_length = 0
        else
            print(result, " ")
            current_line_length += word_length
        end
        
        print(result, word)
    end
    
    return String(take!(result))
end
```

You can test this function with a sample string like so:

```julia
sample_string = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus eget erat vitae velit venenatis tincidunt."
println(wrap_string(sample_string))
```

This will print:

```
Lorem 
ipsum 
dolor 
sit amet, 
consectetur 
adipiscing elit. 
Vivamus eget erat 
vitae velit 
venenatis tincidunt.
```
